Pre-Game Insights: The Guardians, who finished the regular season strong at home with a 50-30 record, are looking to capitalize on their success against the Tigers.
Offensively, José Ramírez has been the engine, hitting 39 home runs and driving in 118 runs.
Outfielder Steven Kwan leads the team with a.292 average.
The Guardians have a solid overall team batting average of.238 and a strong bullpen.
Their team ERA matches Detroit at 3.61.
Pitching in Game 1 will be Tanner Bibee, who has performed well against Detroit in the regular season.
Detroit comes into this matchup after beating Houston twice, but will face a tough challenge in Cleveland.
The Tigers, who finished tied with Kansas City in the AL Central standings at 86-76, enter the postseason after winning two of their last three games against Houston.
Riley Greene, their key offensive player, has posted 24 home runs with a.262 average.
Tyler Holton is set to start for the Tigers.
Given that the Guardians have beaten the Tigers in all three of Bibee’s starts this season, they are in a strong position to take Game 1.
